data.title: MSTR shares rise 8% to $274.52 on S&P 500 speculation with record earnings of $3.9B in Q3 and $12B for 9 months. CEO hints at global market expansion.
data.description: Shares of Strategy Inc. (NASDAQ: MSTR) surged by 8% to reach $274.52 on Friday amidst investor excitement over the company's stellar financial performance and mounting speculation regarding its possible inclusion in the S&P 500 index. Analysts are attributing this surge to the company's robust fundamentals and the potential S&P 500 listing. In the third quarter, Strategy Inc. reported a remarkable operating income of $3.9 billion and net income of $2.9 billion, marking a significant improvement from the losses suffered in the previous year. In the first nine months of 2025, the company posted $12 billion in operating income and $8.6 billion in net income. Earnings per share also saw a substantial rise, reaching $27.71 compared to a loss of $2.71 in the preceding year. CEO Phong Le, in an earnings call, hinted at the company's strategic expansion plans into global markets by laying the groundwork for credit securities in international territories. This marks Strategy Inc.'s second consecutive quarter of eligibility for potential... (Continued on Benzinga.com)

data.title: TrxNow marks 11th anniversary with Halloween Costume Contest, featuring special guest from WJHL – TV DayTime Tri-Cities.
data.description: In Johnson City, Tennessee on October 31, 2025, TrxNow, a top provider of cloud-based solutions in the roadside assistance sector, marks its 11th anniversary by hosting the annual Halloween Costume Contest. The event features special guest Chris McIntosh from WJHL - TV DayTime Tri-Cities.

data.title: Author Jay C. Bugg's new post-apocalyptic Christian thriller questions humanity's survival with focus on faith and spiritual awakening.
data.description: Jay C. Bugg, an author, highlights themes of faith, sacrifice, and spiritual enlightenment in his latest story. Based in Austin, Texas, the story discusses the looming danger to humanity's existence, emphasizing the internal breakdown of society over external threats. The narrative prompts introspection on the fragility of human connections and values, urging readers to contemplate the essence of survival amidst uncertain times. Released on October 31, 2025, this thought-provoking tale by Jay C. Bugg resonates with readers seeking deeper insights into the human experience.

data.title: U.S. auto market stable in Q3 with average new-car prices at $49,000; U.S.-built inventory at 56% of supply.
data.description: The average price of new cars has remained stable around $49,000 for the past 24 months, with U.S.-manufactured vehicles making up 56% of the inventory available at dealerships. This data was released at a recent event in Chicago on October 31, 2025. Cars.com Inc. (NYSE: CARS), also known as Cars Commerce Inc., a technology company focused on engaging automotive audiences, provided these insights.

data.title: Craneware Group hosts 340B Rebate Forum with 25 health systems, 8 rebate plans approved by HRSA for Jan 1, 2026 launch.
data.description: Hospitals are now in a 60-day preparation phase following the approval by HRSA of eight manufacturer rebate plans before the anticipated launch on January 1, 2026. The gathering in Deerfield Beach, Florida, on October 31, 2025, organized by The Craneware Group, brought together top officials from 25 prominent U.S. health systems and other representatives to discuss the upcoming changes.

data.title: Author James Edward Cleland introduced architecture and design into Loyola Academy's Fine Arts Program, inspired by former Loyola University Chicago Dean Gerald L. Gutek.
data.description: Renowned author James Edward Cleland has revolutionized the Fine Arts Program at Loyola Academy in Chicago. This initiative, influenced by the esteemed Gerald L. Gutek, Ph.D., aims to integrate architecture and design into the curriculum. Cleland, a dedicated teacher, is spearheading this transformation at Loyola Academy, following in the footsteps of the esteemed former Dean of Loyola University Chicago. This introduction of architecture and design is poised to impact a significant number of students, enhancing their educational experience and creativity within the Fine Arts Program.

data.title: LC appoints Michael Jordan as Chief Investment Officer, enhancing company's growth strategy. A crucial step forward for LC.
data.description: In Columbus, Ohio, Lifestyle Communities (LC), a renowned mixed-use developer focusing on innovative apartment living, appointed Michael Jordan as the new Chief Investment Officer. Jordan's appointment signifies a significant milestone in LC's growth trajectory. He will spearhead the company's investment strategy, steering through changing market dynamics. LC emphasizes creating engaging communities where residents cherish their living spaces and sense a strong belonging. This strategic move aims to further enhance LC's market presence and foster sustainable development.

data.title: Brazil-based OranjeBTC buys back stock instead of Bitcoin, breaking trend of BTC investments in treasury.
data.description: A recent report indicates that the global economy is expected to grow by 4% in 2022, rebounding from a 3.5% contraction in 2020 due to the pandemic. The recovery is attributed to the successful vaccination rollout and government stimulus packages. Additionally, the report forecasts that inflation will reach 3.2% this year, reflecting increased consumer demand and supply chain disruptions. Unemployment is projected to decline to 6.2%, down from the 2020 peak of 8.1%. However, the report warns of potential economic risks, such as rising debt levels and geopolitical tensions. Overall, the outlook for the global economy in 2022 is cautiously optimistic, with a focus on addressing challenges to sustain growth.

data.title: Kansas City Life Insurance's net income rose to $3.2 million ($0.33/share) in Q3 2025 from $1.3 million ($0.14/share) in Q3 2024.
data.description: In the third quarter of 2025, Kansas City Life Insurance Company reported a net income of $3.2 million, which translates to $0.33 per share. This is a significant increase from the net income of $1.3 million, or $0.14 per share, recorded in the same quarter of 2024. The company's profits saw a strong improvement in the latest financial quarter.
